org.apache.commons.validator.routines

Class EmailValidatorTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.commons.validator.routines.EmailValidatorTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class EmailValidatorTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    Performs Validation Test for e-mail validations.
    Version:
    $Revision$

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      private static org.apache.commons.validator.ResultPair[] testEmailFromPerl
      These test values derive directly from RFC 822 & Mail::RFC822::Address & RFC::RFC822::Address perl test.pl For traceability don't combine these test values with other tests.
      private org.apache.commons.validator.routines.EmailValidator validator

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void _testEmailFromPerl()
      Write this test based on perl Mail::RFC822::Address which takes its example email address directly from RFC822 FIXME This test fails so disable it with a leading _ for 1.1.4 release.
      protected void setUp() 
      protected void tearDown() 
      void testEmail()
      Tests the e-mail validation.
      void testEmailAtTLD()
      Tests the e-mail validation with a user at a TLD http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321#section-2.3.5 (In the case of a top-level domain used by itself in an email address, a single string is used without any dots)
      void testEmailExtension()
      Tests the e-mail validation.
      void testEmailLocalhost()
      Test that @localhost and @localhost.localdomain addresses are declared as valid when requested.
      void testEmailUserName()
      Write this test according to parts of RFC, as opposed to the type of character that is being tested.
      void testEmailWithBogusCharacter()
      Tests the e-mail validation with an RCS-noncompliant character in the address.
      void testEmailWithCommas()
      Tests the email validation with commas.
      void testEmailWithControlChars()
      Tests the email validation with ascii control characters.
      void testEmailWithDash()
      Tests the e-mail validation with a dash in the address.
      void testEmailWithDotEnd()
      Tests the e-mail validation with a dot at the end of the address.
      void testEmailWithNumericAddress()
      Tests the email validation with numeric domains.
      void testEmailWithSlashes()
      VALIDATOR-296 - A / or a ! is valid in the user part, but not in the domain part
